extension.searchTitle: FINANCIAL CHOICE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 98

congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.
So the amendment was agreed to.
So the amendment was agreed to.
So the amendment was agreed to.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 10, to create hope and opportunity for investors, consumers, and entrepreneurs by ending bailouts and Too Big to Fail, holding Washington and Wall Street accountable, eliminating red tape to increase access to capital and credit, and repealing the provisions of the Dodd-Frank Act that make America less prosperous, less stable, and less free, by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 186 nays, Roll No. 299.
